caribbean.name: Caribbean
caribbean.description: Classic tropical diving with vibrant reefs and wrecks
caribbean.bestTime: December–May for best conditions, but year-round diving.

bahamas.name: Bahamas
bahamas.description: Crystal clear waters, blue holes, and shark encounters.
bahamas.bestTime: November–May for best visibility and weather.

cayman-islands.name: Cayman Islands
cayman-islands.description: World-class wall diving, Stingray City, and clear Caribbean waters.

turks-caicos.name: Turks & Caicos
turks-caicos.description: Wall diving, humpback whales, and pristine reefs.
turks-caicos.bestTime: January–April for humpbacks; December–May for diving.

jamaica.name: Jamaica
jamaica.description: Laid-back diving, reefs, and wrecks in warm waters.

usvi.name: U.S. Virgin Islands
usvi.description: Wrecks, reefs, and easy island hopping.

bvi.name: British Virgin Islands
bvi.description: Wreck of the Rhone, coral gardens, and calm anchorages.

dominican-republic.name: Dominican Republic
dominican-republic.description: Caves, wrecks, and whale watching in Samaná Bay.

cuba.name: Cuba
cuba.description: Jardines de la Reina, wrecks, and healthy reefs.

aruba.name: Aruba
aruba.description: Wrecks, reefs, and year-round warm water.

bonaire.name: Bonaire
bonaire.description: Shore diving capital, marine park, and easy access reefs.

curacao.name: Curaçao
curacao.description: Colorful reefs, wrecks, and vibrant marine life.

st-martin.name: St. Martin / Sint Maarten
st-martin.description: Wrecks, reefs, and a blend of French and Dutch culture.

st-lucia.name: St. Lucia
st-lucia.description: Pitons, wall dives, and healthy reefs.

barbados.name: Barbados
barbados.description: Wrecks, turtles, and easy shore diving.

grenada.name: Grenada
grenada.description: Wreck diving capital of the Caribbean, including the Bianca C.

st-vincent-grenadines.name: St. Vincent & the Grenadines
st-vincent-grenadines.description: Critter diving, reefs, and volcanic islands.

guadeloupe.name: Guadeloupe
guadeloupe.description: Cousteau Reserve, reefs, and French-Caribbean culture.
